snippet: In a Washington appeals court, judges heard arguments about whether the insurance giant deserved to be labeled a systemically important financial institution....
abstract: Federal appeals court in Washington hears Justice Dept case seeking to overturn district court ruling that removed so-called systemically important financial institution designation for MetLife, freeing insurance giant of extra regulatory oversight via 2010 Dodd-Frank Act; group of lawmakers are supporting Justice Dept's appeal.
lead_paragraph: In a Washington appeals court, judges heard arguments about whether the insurance giant deserved to be labeled a systemically important financial institution.

headline.main: MetLife Again Faces Off With Regulators Over Its Too-Big-to-Fail Status
headline.print_headline: MetLife Again Faces Off With Regulators Over ‘Too Big to Fail’ Status

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
